      • buyBalanced

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> buyBalanced​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> stocksNWeights,
                                                                          java.time.LocalDate dateAt,
                                                                          double amount)
                                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: BetterStockModel
        Used for buying multiple stocks with a certain amount of money. The portion of money being spent on each, is based on the corresponding weights for each stalk (adding up to 100%).
        Specified by:
        buyBalanced in interface BetterStockModel
        Parameters:
        stocksNWeights - the stocks and percentage of the money to spend on each NOTE: (weights MUST add up to 100%)
        amount - of shares to buy
        Returns:
        the shares of each stock bought.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the stocks don't exist, or the weights given do not add up to 100%

        public java.lang.String reBalance​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> stocksNWeights,
                                  java.time.LocalDate dateAt)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: BetterStockModel
        Used for re-balancing stocks already in your portfolio with money that you already have invested in them.
        Specified by:
        reBalance in interface BetterStockModel
        Parameters:
        stocksNWeights - the stocks and new monetary weights that should be assigned relative to the total value of all those stocks in the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the new amounts of each
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the stocks don't exist *in the portfolio*, or the weights given do not add up to 100%
